newsitem.title: USA: CME live cattle calls mixed, feeders lower.
newsitem.headline: CME live cattle calls mixed, feeders lower.

text.p: Early calls on CME live cattle futures ranged from 0.150 cent higher to 0.150 cent lower while feeder cattle were called 0.200 to 0.300 cent lower, analysts said.

Further support in nearby live cattle futures is expected to stem from rising boxed beef values and expected higher cash cattle markets. Retailers appear to be stocking up on beef for May featuring and expectations are for fed cattle to trade up to at least $68 per cwt, analysts said.
However, futures are at a premium which may limit gains, they said.

Deferred live cattle contracts and all feeder cattle contracts look lower following sharply higher grain futures. Corn futures are called higher following limit projections in wheat futures, analysts said.
A lower CME feeder cattle index should also weigh on the market, they added.
The latest CME feeder cattle index was off $0.22 at $70.97 per cwt.
